entries.title: How the world reacted to 'the best World Cup final ever'
entries.description: This World Cup final was a game that seemed to defy comprehension, conventions and any attempt to describe it.

entries.title: Lionel Messi wins the Golden Ball award
Lionel Messi-inspired Argentina wins World Cup title after beating France in sensational final
entries.description: Lionel Messi's wait for World Cup glory is finally over after Argentina beat France in a dramatic penalty shootout on Sunday.

entries.title: One dead in strikes on Russian region near Ukraine, Belgorod governor says
entries.description: One person was reported dead and eight people were injured in the Russian region of Belgorod on Sunday following shelling by Ukrainian forces, according to the regional governor.

entries.title: Superstars Mbappé and Messi face off in World Cup final
Argentine soccer great Lionel Messi is playing in his last World Cup match as France and 23-year-old Kylian Mbappé aim to make history
Israel deports French-Palestinian lawyer it accuses of terrorism, Israeli group calls it violation of rights
entries.description: Israel deported a French-Palestinian lawyer it accused of organizing, inciting and planning "terrorist attacks" to France early Sunday morning, Israeli authorities said, in a case that an Israeli human rights organization called a "gross violation of basic rights."

entries.title: Pope Francis has already signed resignation letter in case of bad health
entries.description: Pope Francis has revealed in a new interview that he has already signed his resignation letter to be used in the event of him becoming "impaired."

entries.title: Overrun Amsterdam targets tourists who plan to 'go wild' with 'stay away' campaign
entries.description: It's barely dusk on a cold Saturday afternoon in early December. But Amsterdam's Red Light District is already starting to heat up.

entries.title: Plight of migrant workers has cast a shadow over World Cup
entries.description: Boniface Barasa worked for three years as a construction worker in Qatar, but the life-long football fan now says he was so traumatized by the experience that he was torn about watching matches during the World Cup.

entries.title: Fresh criticism for Qatar and FIFA as World Cup ends on International Migrants Day
entries.description: As the 2022 World Cup comes to a close, global rights organizations have renewed criticism of Qatar and FIFA over the treatment of thousands of migrant workers who built stadiums and tournament infrastructure.

entries.title: From unloved to hero. How Messi won over his fiercest critics
entries.description: When engaging in discussions or debates about the greatest players of all time, soccer fans and pundits will often point to tangible achievements: trophies, individual accolades or scoring records.

entries.title: North Korea fires two more missiles in a record year for launches
entries.description: North Korea fired two ballistic missiles into the waters off its east coast on Sunday, the latest in what has been a record year for test launches by the Kim Jong Un regime.

entries.title: Acclaimed Iranian actress arrested after criticizing execution of protester
entries.description: One of Iran's best-known actresses has been arrested days after she criticized the execution of a man involved in the nationwide protests that have swept the country since September.

entries.title: El Paso mayor declares state of emergency in response to migrant surge
entries.description: El Paso, Texas, Mayor Oscar Leeser declared a state of emergency on Saturday evening following a surge of migrants who have recently arrived in the community and he says are living in unsafe conditions.

entries.title: World Cup final preview: France takes on Argentina in mouthwatering clash
entries.description: After a month of unpredictable results, we are left with two World Cup heavyweights going head-to-head in a mouthwatering final as reigning champion France faces two-time champion Argentina Sunday.

entries.title: Exclusive: Ukraine's presidential office criticizes FIFA for refusing to show Zelensky's message of peace at World Cup Final
entries.description: Ukraine's presidential office is criticizing FIFA for refusing to show a video message from President Volodymyr Zelensky in Qatar's Lusail Stadium ahead of the World Cup final on Sunday.

entries.title: 'Like walking on missiles': US airman recalls the horror of the Vietnam 'Christmas bombings' 50 years on
entries.description: It was one of the heaviest bombardments in history. A shock-and-awe campaign of overwhelming air power aimed at bombing into submission a determined opponent that, despite being vastly outgunned, had withstood everything the world's most formidable war machine could throw at it.
